did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle:
Methodist Episcopal Church, South, Virginia Conference, Norfolk District, Princess Anne Circuit, Register,
1828-1868

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Methodists Episcopal Church, South. Virginia Conference. Norfolk District. Princess Anne Circuit. Register, 1828-1868. Princess Anne County Reel 54. Church records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred to the Library of Virginia by Clerk of Circuit Court, Princess Anne County, Virginia, 7 October 1950.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: In 1814, the Methodist Church assigned pastors to the Norfolk District to cover Portsmouth, Suffolk and Princess Anne. In 1819, Princess Anne was established as an individual circuit. The circuit included the churches of Olive Branch, Ebenezer, Good Hope, Deep Creek, Bear Quarter and Brea in Princess Anne County; and Sharon in Camden County, North Carolina. In 1888, South Princess Anne Circuit was formed from Princess Anne Circuit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Register, 1828-1868, containing membership lists; infant baptisms, 1831-1868; adult baptisms, 1842-1859, 1866; and marriages, 1832-1854, 1866. The membership lists include an alphabetical list; a revised and corrected membership list by classes, November 1859; a special register, 1853; and a register of colored members, November 1859. Some birth, marriage and death data are noted in the membership lists.
